meanings.sent1: We must finish our homework ere dinner time.
meanings.sent2: The sun sets ere the night falls.
meanings.sent3: Let's leave ere the rain starts pouring.
meanings.sent4: The birds chirp ere the dawn breaks.
meanings.sent5: He always arrives ere the meeting begins.

meanings.sent1: I will wait ere you return.
meanings.sent2: She will study ere she understands the lesson.
meanings.sent3: I will keep singing ere my voice gives out.
meanings.sent4: He will keep running ere he reaches the finish line.
meanings.sent5: They will play ere the sun sets.

meanings.sent1: The cat sat ere the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: She stood ere the mirror, fixing her hair.
meanings.sent3: The dog lay ere the door, waiting to be let in.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed ere the garden gate.
meanings.sent5: The children played ere the school building.
